III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two youth exposed their genitals to another youth while the youth
was participating in an online therapy session. Two staff
members were present but did not observe this.

She reported these group meetings are virtual and streamed on the

She reported Youth B does have a plan in place due to bringing in

Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on February 12, 2024. Staff 2

reported she was working on paperwork during the meeting, while

observing and within an earshot to redirect the situation.
Tour Observation:
A tour of the facility occurred on February 5, 2024. Upon entering
the unit there is an open concept space where the youth can sit at a
table for mealtimes. To left of the room there is a tv sitting area,
which is where the youth were sit during virtual meeting. Staff are
able to see the youth within this area from where it was described
where they were all sitting from Staff 1 and Youth A’s interviews.
Documents Reviewed:
- Policies/Procedures: Client Safety Policy (05-09) April 18,
2018. This document indicates staff are to always keep youth
safe and secure while in care. Staff are also to adhere to this
procedure and implement specific supervision practices that
are necessary.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 did not have any
disciplinary action noted within her HR file due to concerns of
lack of supervision of the youth. She did have to two different
written warnings within the file due to a missed medication
and speeding while driving concern. Staff 1 is up to date on
her required training and has completed team trainings that
have reviewed supervision expectations on 01/17/2023.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File- Staff 2 had no disciplinary
actions noted within her HR file. Staff 2 is up to date on her
4

required training and has completed a review in supervision
requirements when Staff 2 started in 2020.
- Youth B’s Individual Program Modification Plan date
01/30/2024- This plan was created due to Youth B continued
to bring in contraband into the unit. This plan notes Youth B
will continue to have more bedroom checks.
Analysis The facility is found to be in compliance with following their
supervision policy. There was no evidence to support that flashing
occurred when staff were not supervising the milieu during the
meeting.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
